metadata.title: CVE-2023-52913 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/i915: Fix potential context UAFsgem_context_register() makes the context visible to userspace, and whichpoint a separate thread can trigger the I915_GEM_CONTEXT_DESTROY ioctl.So we need to ensure that nothing uses the ctx ptr after this.  And weneed to ensure that adding the ctx to the xarray is the *last* thingthat gem_context_register() does with the ctx pointer.[tursulin: Stable and fixes tags add/tidy.](cherry picked from commit bed4b455cf5374e68879be56971c1da563bcd90c)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
